title: Patch 7.5 are you actually serious????
body: That Distortion nerf for LeBlanc is ACTUALLY TOO FAR! Are you serious? 60% ---> 20% ap and the base damage nerfed THAT much? Wtf are you trying to do? Have the enemy at 3/4 hp level 18 after her full combo? SHE'S AN ASSASSIN/MAGE AND NEEDS TO DO DAMAGE. I get she's strong and permabanned in ranked but come on wtf is that nerf? Her damage isn't the problem in case you haven't worked it out, it's items/masteries that go WITH her kit. All you've done since the assassin rework is gut her alive like wtf? This is actually going to destroy her and I hope you're happy with that and will leave her alone. All player support had to say was, "It's important that we don't make rash balance decisions. Sometimes it appears that a Champion is too strong or too weak, when the problem really lies elsewhere. If we immediately fixed the symptom, instead of looking for the cause of the balance issue, our game would be in a much worse state." LOL it's currently in a bad state because the balancing team sucks in all honesty, they focus too much on her kit because people cry about her when they don't realise masteries like Greenfather's Gift, Assassin, Merciless and Double Edged Sword are present? Items like Morellonomicon with the greivous wounds? Rabadons Deathcap granting bonus % ap? There are way more problematic champions than LeBlanc and if you're laning against her and she uses Distortion on you, then Shatter Orb, that's on you for sticking around to take damage or not trying to trade back. If she hits you with her chain right next to you you can easily outplay her, people are just lazy and would rather bitch and cry. She's been nerfed for 6 out of 7 patches in a row, when will you leave her alone??

Like Talon12 says, she should have to work for a kill by utilising her _whole_ kit, not just landing a couple of spells. 

Its my view that all assassins should be able to 100-0 almost anything except a tank, but ONLY if they perform their combo absolutely perfectly, hitting **all **their spells at 
the **right** time. 

As it stands currently, champions like Leblanc, Fizz, and Zed could jump on someone, miss half of their kit, abort the fight, and still come away with a kill. 

Like riot said in her update and again in the 7.5 patch notes, the purpose of LeBlanc is to _deceive_ the enemy, not suddenly remove them from the game. And and by definition, _deceiving_ someone requires them to be alive long enough to actually fall for (or outplay) the deception.  As it was until now, there was no need to deceive someone, when you could just jump on them and squash them flat before they realised. 

if you want to jump in, assassinate someone and jump out, then play point and clicks like Fizz or Zed. But want you want to drastically outplay someone so much that they stare at a grey screen going... "I need to watch the replay of that, just to understand wtf happened." thats when you pick Leblanc. 

what this patch does is try to force her into her intended playstyle, and away from the playstyle of other assassins. 

and in any case, riot said that this isnt the final conclusion, they clearly say that she was such a big problem in some areas that their number 1 priority was to remove the problem. They felt that it was more important to get rid of the problem than it was to make sure she was in a healthy state afterwards. 

So they got rid of the problem by nerfing her damage, and now they will start building her back up, trying to get her to be more _deceptive_ instead of outright bursty.

except riot is notoriously bad at understanding 'deception' and 'premeditated' gameplay mechanics, they either end up a bit too strong, or a bit overlooked. So I do pity leblanc mains, goodluck in future and maybe start learning a backup like ahri or fizz.

Leblanc on the other hand. She should be using her w as a utility, not to straight up nuke 4 people at once and still have the rest of her kit available. She had no need to use her q for anything but wave clear simply because she already insta killed the enemy laner and their gank by pressing w, but not only was it a massive damage nuke, it was also a dash and a return dash, on top of having a very short cooldown with a relatively cheap cost, the spell offered too much for too little. Talon needs to use everything to kill targets. Akali needs to go all out to kill her targets too, even fizz does, but leblanc presses w then presses it again, going scott free with a kill and no need for her other spells. As such a compromise needed to be made.

There is a sort of unintended favouritism that goes on in league, In a way.

Every man and his dog plays Lee Sin/Zed/Yasuo etc. and so Riot is very hesitant about touching those champs in fear of pissing off 80% of their clientele, so these champs only every receive minor nerfs or buffs and are never really 'changed'. despite whatever problems they may continue to cause. 

Where champs like Shyv, Aatrox (and allegedly Aurelion Sol) get random huge updates (like the 7.5 Aatrox one) out of the blue, when they aren't anywhere near as problematic to the game, in an attempt to make them more appealing to the general audience, and said updates are released without any consultation from or consideration to the people who already play those champs. Purely because if they fuck up on those champs, the player % they lose is almost negligible, in relation to the player % they hope to gain. 

So while I'm sure the balance and update teams don't have actual favourites, there are some champions that need to be favoured from a business standpoint. (Riot is a business, and businesses do have to make money conscious decisions.)

Its not fair, but no one said it had to be. 

So LB obviously falls into the category where she has enough players to not warrant a complete overhaul, but not popular enough to save her from nerfs when she is actually a big problem.
